issue.title: Clean parked domains in AdGuard Base filters list partially
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

The [parkedDomain2](https://github.com/List-KR/parkedDomain2) reports that the following domains are parked:

- [ ] vidzi.tv
- [ ] vidzi.tv

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://datacaciques.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdatacaciques.com) ### Comment > Hi AdGuard Team, > > I am the administrator of datacaciques.com. Our website provides a comprehensive service for e-commerce sellers, including a script for visitor statistics. I believe this script may have caused our main domain to be added to your tracker list. > > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/2c5260d362d66b4f629c2eb7aca064b13d174619/SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers.txt#L682 > > However, blocking our primary domain prevents our customers from accessing our website at https://www.datacaciques.com. > > Could you please remove datacaciques.com from the blocklist and add only the specific subdomain used for tracking, pv.datacaciques.com, instead? Our main domain should not be blocked from normal user access. > Username: `@iammapping` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hi, @Alex-302 

Thank you for your response and for the clarification regarding DNS servers.

We understand that users who work in marketing might need to adjust their ad-blocking settings. However, the core issue is that our customers—many of whom are not in marketing roles—are being prevented from accessing our main website, https://www.datacaciques.com, which is a business tool for e-commerce sellers, not an advertising platform.

Thank you also for pointing out gate.datacaciques.com. You are correct, this is another subdomain we use for analytics and tracking.

We are not trying to bypass the filters. Our goal is simply to ensure our customers can access our main service.

Therefore, we kindly ask that you keep the tracking subdomains, pv.datacaciques.com and gate.datacaciques.com, on your blocklist. We just need the main domain, datacaciques.com, to be removed from the list to allow normal user access.

This solution would allow users to continue blocking specific trackers while ensuring our main website remains accessible.

Thank you for your help in resolving this.

comment.body:
> I don't know how the check is performed when opening a script in a browser. That is, do you use the presence of certain elements, requests, or words as one of your checks? If not, then the rules will not affect it. I'm just playing it safe.

OK. Just clearify that parkedDomain2 does not use any web browser and make a HTTP request to a domain that will be checked to make a decision: parked or not.
The tool uses DNS only.

issue.title: Clean parked domains in AdGuard Base filters list
